channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Measures to protect Trump from coronavirus scale up
Mike Pence pressed on holding campaign events amid pandemic
item.description: Vice President Mike Pence was pressed on the wisdom of holding campaign rallies, even as the administration's own public health experts continue to warn against large public gatherings and as coronavirus cases surge.

item.title: The three women who should be at the top of Biden's VP list
item.description: The selection of a running mate is among the biggest decisions a presidential candidate will make during their candidacy. The decision is particularly weighty when one realizes that one in five US presidents have not completed their full terms.

item.title: China opened an embassy on a remote island during the pandemic. Here's why
item.description: On a blue-sky day in May, as the coronavirus raged across the world, the Chinese flag was raised on a remote nation with a total population of 116,000, thousands of miles from Beijing.

item.title: Satellite images show buildup at site of deadly India-China border clash
Trump was asked about a second term. Hear his response
item.description: During a Fox News town hall, President Trump gave a non-answer when asked about his priorities for a possible second term.

item.title: Why the EU is so White
item.description: The killing of George Floyd in the United States and the subsequent Black Lives Matter protests around the world have given reason for some awkward, long-overdue soul-searching in the European Union about the treatment of its Black and ethnic minority citizens.

item.title: Restrictions leave US travelers high and dry
item.description: In downtown Buffalo, New York, crossing the border into Ontario, Canada, used to be as easy as driving one mile across the Peace Bridge over the Niagara River. But that's now a forbidden route.

item.title: The US reported more than 40,000 cases on Friday
item.description: Texas governor admits he reopened bars too soon

item.title: A biracial woman was set on fire. The FBI is investigating it as a hate crime
Three people died and one is permanently blind after drinking hand sanitizer in New Mexico
item.description: Three people died and one is permanently blind from methanol poisoning after drinking hand sanitizer in New Mexico, health officials said.

item.title: Wirecard's collapse reveals cracks at heart of Germany, Inc
item.description: It's been a spectacularly bad week for German business.

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
California woman coughed on a baby in social distancing dispute, police say
item.description: Police are investigating video of an alleged assault that occurred at a Yogurtland in California where a woman is seen coughing in the face of a baby, allegedly because the mother was not maintaining proper social distance.

item.title: Officers involved in death of Elijah McClain reassigned for their safety
item.description: Three Colorado police officers involved in a confrontation that left a Black man dead last year have been reassigned to "nonenforcement" duties, authorities said.

item.title: Siya Kakkar, teenage TikTok star, has died, her manager confirms
item.description: Siya Kakkar, a teenage TikTok influencer with a significant fanbase on the video-sharing platform, has died, her manager has said.

item.title: Germany troop withdrawal highlights rise of two White House allies
item.description: The White House's plan to withdraw thousands of US troops from Germany is emerging as a new point of tension between the President and top Pentagon leaders, including Defense Secretary Mark Esper, who has avoided criticizing the move publicly but has significant concerns about it, multiple current and former officials tell CNN.

item.title: Facebook takes down videos targeting California public health officers
item.description: Facebook has removed at least four videos posted by a group accused of targeting California public health officers over their directives to stay home and wear face masks to prevent spread of the coronavirus.

item.title: Photos show the Cape Town you don't usually see
item.description: When you think of Cape Town, what do you imagine? Perhaps you picture Table Mountain, penguins on the sand, or the stunning beaches that surround this city.

item.title: Judge rules migrant children in detention centers must be released
item.description: The US government must release migrant children held in government family detention centers by mid-July due to the coronavirus pandemic, a federal judge ruled Friday.

item.title: Paralympian Angela Madsen dies trying to row from California to Hawaii
item.description: Three-time Paralympian Angela Madsen died earlier this week while attempting a solo row from Los Angeles to Honolulu.

item.title: As Liverpool party, 30 years ago the world was a very different place
item.description: If you were to compare the world in Liverpool's two most recent English title wins, in 1990 and 2020, it is almost unrecognizable.

item.title: There were good news this week, too. Here are our favorites
item.description: Want more inspiring, positive news? Sign up for The Good Stuff, a newsletter for the good in life. It will brighten your inbox every Saturday morning.

item.title: Comedian regrets mostly White male cast
item.description: Comedian Jon Stewart admits his late-night show "The Daily show" didn't do enough to address diversity and regrets having a mostly white male staff.

item.title: Witness in Mueller investigation gets 10 years in prison in child sex case
item.description: George Nader, who was a key witness in the Russia investigation and informally advised President Donald Trump's team on foreign policy, was sentenced on Friday to 10 years in prison by a federal judge in Virginia, stemming from his convictions on child sex charges.

item.title: Teenager who threw a child from Tate Modern jailed for at least 15 years
item.description: A London judge has handed down a sentence of at least 15 years in prison to a teenager who threw a young French boy from a viewing platform at the Tate Modern art gallery last summer, telling him "you may never be released."

item.title: A huge dust plume from the Sahara Desert is closing in on the US
item.description: A dust plume from the Sahara Desert traveled across the Atlantic and is darkening skies in the Caribbean. One model predicts it will reach the Southeastern and Mid-Atlantic US.

item.title: Liz Cheney posts photo of former VP in face mask and says 'real men wear masks'
item.description: Wyoming Rep. Liz Cheney posted a photo of former Vice President Dick Cheney sporting a face mask on Friday and took a shot at the manhood of people who refuse to wear face coverings in a seeming jab at President Donald Trump.

item.title: A nation's whitewashed history is being called into question
item.description: After years of resisting calls for its removal, New York's American Museum of Natural History (AMNH) has asked the city to dislodge from its front steps an equestrian monument to Theodore Roosevelt, the twenty-sixth US president, which depicts him charging forward, and towering over two mostly nude figures, one Black and one Indigenous.

item.title: Trump calls out reporter on face mask
item.description: As Covid-19 cases spike in the US, President Trump is trying to change the subject. CNN's Jim Acosta reports.

item.title: See rare home videos of Michael Jackson
item.description: Facebook Watch's "Unfiltered: Paris Jackson & Gabriel Glenn" takes viewers on a journey through music and life with Michael Jackson's daughter Paris.

item.title: Wrongly arrested man sues police
item.description: Video shows the moment police in Valdosta, Georgia slammed a man to the ground and broke his wrist before it turned out that he was not the person they were looking for.

item.title: Bill Gates predicted the pandemic. Hear his advice now.
item.description: Microsoft founder Bill Gates discusses his pandemic prediction, and why the US is struggling to contain the coronavirus.

item.title: Endless summers of the communist riviera
item.description: During the communist era, travel options were limited in Hungary and Central Europe, which meant Lake Balaton became the region's most popular vacation destination.

item.title: This major cruise ship is headed for the scrap heap amid Covid-19 crisis
item.description: A major cruise liner with only 23 years of service has been earmarked for the scrap heap amid a coronavirus-driven downturn for the leisure shipping industry.

item.title: National Women's Soccer League is the first professional league to resume
item.description: The National Women's Soccer League (NWSL) is returning to action this weekend after the start of its season was delayed due to the pandemic.

item.title: A man wins a $4 million lottery jackpot — for the second time
item.description: When most can't manage to get a $20 return on a scratch off, one Michigan man walked away with $4 million ... TWICE!!

item.title: YouTube influencer quits her channel after blackface backlash
item.description: YouTube star Jenna Mourey, known by her channel name Jenna Marbles, announced Thursday she is leaving the platform amid a controversy over racially offensive videos.

item.title: The Dixie Chicks are now called The Chicks
item.description: The former Dixie Chicks announced they will now be known as The Chicks, dropping the reference to the pre-Civil War South from the group's name.

item.title: Justin Bieber files $20 million defamation lawsuit against women who accused him of assault
item.description: Justin Bieber has filed a $20 million defamation lawsuit against two women who accused him earlier this week of sexual assault.

item.title: Sherlock Holmes is too nice in Netflix adaptation, lawsuit argues
item.description: Arthur Conan Doyle's estate is suing Netflix, among others, over its upcoming film "Enola Holmes" -- arguing that the show's depiction of Sherlock Holmes as kind, caring and respectful of women is a violation of the author's copyright.

item.title: NASA is offering $35,000 to design a toilet that will work on the moon
item.description: NASA wants you to help put the loo in lunar, so it's offering $35,000 in prizes to design a toilet that can be used on the moon.

item.title: The President, concerned with how it would look if he got sick, insists on stronger protections even as he seeks to move past the pandemic
item.description: • Coronavirus pandemic: Live updates from around the world • As pandemic situation worsens, Pence paints a deceptively rosy picture • US reports highest number of new coronavirus cases in a single day ... again • See Gupta's response to Pence's virus claim • Covid-19 antibody treatments could be close

item.title: 5 states report highest number of coronavirus cases in one day
item.description: At least five states reported their highest single day record of Covid-19 cases Friday, adding to the growing concern of case increases that has sent many states back-peddling on their reopening plans.

item.title: As pandemic worsens, Pence paints a deceptively rosy picture
item.description: The US had just hit a single-day record for new coronavirus cases. More than half the states were seeing increases in the rate of new cases. Multiple states were dealing with record numbers of coronavirus hospitalizations. Texas had announced hours earlier that it had to shut down in-person service at its bars again.

item.title: Dr. Gupta: We are in the middle of a public health disaster
item.description: CNN's Sanjay Gupta breaks down the White House coronavirus task force briefing in which Vice President Mike Pence said that the reopening economy was encouraging news as cases hit an all-time record in the US.

item.title: An antibody treatment could be closer than a vaccine
item.description: Vaccines have gotten all the attention in the race to fight Covid-19, but there is a major push in the United States to develop antibody therapies to treat coronavirus. There's so much of a push that some scientists think these treatments may be available this year, even before a vaccine.

item.title: US officials say they appreciate European transparency over coronavirus travel ban
Reporter poses a difficult question for Mike Pence
item.description: CNN's Dana Bash compares Vice President Mike Pence's remarks at the coronavirus task force briefing to the infamous Vietnam-era 'Five o'clock follies' where the government provided a version of events that were very different from the reality people were seeing.

item.title: A biracial woman says she was set on fire. Authorities have launched a hate crime investigation.
item.description: Madison police and the FBI have launched a hate crime investigation after an 18-year-old biracial woman was set on fire.
